name: ATM Jackpotting DFIR 2025
description: MITRE ATT&CK layer for ATM jackpotting incident investigated by Thai Cyber Police, 2025. Includes sub-techniques for detailed DFIR analysis based on typical jackpotting methods (malware, black-box devices).

techniques.comment: Exploit vulnerabilities in ATM software or network interfaces remotely (e.g., Diebold Nixdorf vulnerabilities).
Spearphishing attachments used to compromise bank networks, enabling remote ATM access (e.g., Cosmos heist).
Windows Command Shell used by malware (e.g., Ploutus.D, Tyupkin) to issue cash dispense commands on Windows-based ATMs.
Malware may add itself to Registry Run Keys or Startup Folder for persistence on ATM reboot.
Switching ATM to supervisor mode to control cash dispensers, a core jackpotting technique.
Attackers delete logs or malware files to remove evidence from ATM systems.
Hiding malware files or using mineral oil/wax to block ATM cameras to conceal activities.
Automated collection of transaction logs or cardholder data, though primary goal is cash dispensing.
Black-box devices use HTTP/HTTPS to communicate with attackersâ€™ smartphones or servers.
Malware may corrupt ATM logs or software to cover tracks.
Displaying 'Out of Service' on ATM screens to avoid suspicion during attacks.
